verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.
verses.web: When Samuel was old, he made his sons judges over Israel.
verses.ct: When Samuel grew old, he appointed his sons as judges over Israel.

verses.kjv: Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abiah: they were judges in Beersheba.
verses.web: Now the name of his firstborn was Joel; and the name of his second, Abijah. They were judges in Beersheba.
verses.ct: His firstborn son was named Joel, and his second son was named Abijah. They served as judges in Beersheba.

verses.kjv: And his sons walked not in his ways, but turned aside after lucre, and took bribes, and perverted judgment.
verses.web: His sons didn’t walk in his ways, but turned away after dishonest gain, took bribes, and perverted justice.
verses.ct: But his sons didn't follow his example. They chased after dishonest money, accepted bribes, and twisted justice.

verses.kjv: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together, and came to Samuel unto Ramah,
verses.web: Then all the elders of Israel gathered themselves together and came to Samuel to Ramah.
verses.ct: So all the elders of Israel gathered together and went to Samuel at Ramah.

verses.kjv: And said unto him, Behold, thou art old, and thy sons walk not in thy ways: now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.
verses.web: They said to him, “Behold, you are old, and your sons don’t walk in your ways. Now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.”
verses.ct: They told him, "Look, you're getting old, and your sons don't follow your ways. Appoint a king to lead us, like all the other nations have."

verses.kjv: But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, Give us a king to judge us. And Samuel prayed unto the LORD.
verses.web: But the thing displeased Samuel, when they said, “Give us a king to judge us.” Samuel prayed to LORD.
verses.ct: Samuel was deeply troubled when they said, "Give us a king to lead us." So he prayed to the LORD about it.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Samuel, Hearken unto the voice of the people in all that they say unto thee: for they have not rejected thee, but they have rejected me, that I should not reign over them.
verses.web: LORD said to Samuel, “Listen to the voice of the people in all that they tell you; for they have not rejected you, but they have rejected me as the king over them.
verses.ct: The LORD told Samuel, "Listen to everything the people are saying to you. They haven't rejected you — they've rejected me as their king.

verses.kjv: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even unto this day, wherewith they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so do they also unto thee.
verses.web: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt even to this day, in that they have forsaken me, and served other gods, so they also do to you.
verses.ct: This is what they've been doing ever since I brought them out of Egypt. They've abandoned me and served other gods, over and over. Now they're doing the same thing to you.

verses.kjv: Now therefore hearken unto their voice: howbeit yet protest solemnly unto them, and shew them the manner of the king that shall reign over them.
verses.web: Now therefore listen to their voice. However you shall protest solemnly to them, and shall show them the way of the king who will reign over them.”
verses.ct: So go ahead and give them what they want. But warn them clearly. Tell them exactly what a king will do to them."

verses.kjv: And Samuel told all the words of the LORD unto the people that asked of him a king.
verses.web: Samuel told all LORD’s words to the people who asked him for a king.
verses.ct: Samuel passed along everything the LORD had said to the people who were demanding a king.

verses.kjv: And he said, This will be the manner of the king that shall reign over you: He will take your sons, and appoint them for himself, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and some shall run before his chariots.
verses.web: He said, “This will be the way of the king who shall reign over you: he will take your sons, and appoint them as his servants, for his chariots, and to be his horsemen; and they will run before his chariots.
verses.ct: He said, "Here's what a king will do to you: He'll draft your sons and assign them to his chariots and cavalry. Some will run ahead of his chariots as an escort.

verses.kjv: And he will appoint him captains over thousands, and captains over fifties; and will set them to ear his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and instruments of his chariots.
verses.web: He will appoint them to him for captains of thousands, and captains of fifties; and he will assign some to plow his ground, and to reap his harvest, and to make his instruments of war, and the instruments of his chariots.
verses.ct: He'll make some of them commanders over thousands and commanders over 50s. Others he'll force to plow his fields, harvest his crops, and build his weapons and chariot equipment.

verses.kjv: And he will take your daughters to be confectionaries, and to be cooks, and to be bakers.
verses.web: He will take your daughters to be perfumers, to be cooks, and to be bakers.
verses.ct: He'll take your daughters to make perfume for him, to cook his food, and to bake his bread.

verses.kjv: And he will take your fields, and your vineyards, and your oliveyards, even the best of them, and give them to his servants.
verses.web: He will take your fields, your vineyards, and your olive groves, even their best, and give them to his servants.
verses.ct: He'll seize your best fields, vineyards, and olive groves and hand them over to his officials.

verses.kjv: And he will take the tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give to his officers, and to his servants.
verses.web: He will take one tenth of your seed, and of your vineyards, and give it to his officers, and to his servants.
verses.ct: He'll take a tenth of your grain and your grape harvest and give it to his officers and servants.

verses.kjv: And he will take your menservants, and your maidservants, and your goodliest young men, and your asses, and put them to his work.
verses.web: He will take your male servants, your female servants, your best young men, and your donkeys, and assign them to his own work.
verses.ct: He'll take your male and female servants, your strongest young men, and your donkeys, and put them all to work for himself.

verses.kjv: He will take the tenth of your sheep: and ye shall be his servants.
verses.web: He will take one tenth of your flocks; and you will be his servants.
verses.ct: He'll take a tenth of your flocks. And you yourselves will become his servants.

verses.kjv: And ye shall cry out in that day because of your king which ye shall have chosen you; and the LORD will not hear you in that day.
verses.web: You will cry out in that day because of your king whom you will have chosen for yourselves; and LORD will not answer you in that day.”
verses.ct: When that day comes, you'll cry out for relief from the king you chose for yourselves — but the LORD won't answer you then."

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel; and they said, Nay; but we will have a king over us;
verses.web: But the people refused to listen to the voice of Samuel; and they said, “No; but we will have a king over us,
verses.ct: But the people refused to listen to Samuel. "No!" they said. "We want a king over us!

verses.kjv: That we also may be like all the nations; and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.
verses.web: that we also may be like all the nations, and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.”
verses.ct: We want to be like all the other nations. We want a king to rule over us, lead us into battle, and fight our wars."

verses.kjv: And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of the LORD.
verses.web: Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of LORD.
verses.ct: Samuel listened to everything the people said, then he repeated it all to the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said to Samuel, Hearken unto their voice, and make them a king. And Samuel said unto the men of Israel, Go ye every man unto his city.
verses.web: LORD said to Samuel, “Listen to their voice, and make them a king.” Samuel said to the men of Israel, “Everyone go to your own city.”
verses.ct: The LORD told Samuel, "Give them what they're asking for. Give them a king." Then Samuel said to the men of Israel, "Go on home, each of you back to your own city."
